document.docAuthor: Romankova, Tatiana G. & Astafurova, Yulia V.
document.masterDocTitle: Bees of the genus Panurginus in Siberia, Far East of Russia, and Allied Areas (Hymenoptera: Andrenidae, Panurginae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Bees of the genus Panurginus in Siberia, Far East of Russia, and Allied Areas (Hymenoptera: Andrenidae, Panurginae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Panurginus niger Nylander, 1948 : 223
, Ƥ. The nominal species of the genus.
Panurginus niger
Friese, 1897
: 32
; 1901 : 31 .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Based on shape of pregenital sterna and genitalia,
P. niger
belongs to the group of species with S 6 lacking ventral hair tufts, gonostyli narrow and penis valves apically bulging and bent inside. Apical structure of the S 6 is closer to P. ro m a n i . S 7 apical structure consists of two parallel, narrowly separated, short teeth (ventral view), resembling those of P. ro m a n i , P. c r a w f ord i and
P. nigripes .

By smooth, not shagreened T 2 –T 4 ,
P. niger
resembles
P. labiatus
, from which it differs by brownish wings (
P. labiatus
: white) and configuration of male sterna.

Geographical distribution. Russia (Irkutsk Oblast, Zabaykalskiy Kray, Buryatia, Primorskiy Kray (
Osytshnjuk, 1995 , as
P. dubius
), *Birobidzhan, Amurskaya Oblast (
Proshchalykin, 2004
as P. d u b i u s ), *Khabarovsk Kray, and * Mongolia .

Type material.
Holotype
: Ƥ, E Sibiria; Sibiria or.; F. Sahlb [Reinhold Ferdinand Sahlberg, leg. (
1811–1874
)], Spec. typ.;
Panurginus niger
(Finnish Museum of Natural History, Helsinki).

Holotype
of
P. dubius
: Ƥ,
RUSSIA
, Irkutsk; F. Morawitz’s coll. [к. Ф. Моравица; Holotypus ].

: Dornod : S Buir-Nur Lake, W Bolshoy Khingan,
25 .VI.1899
, 13, V. Soldatov; Derhin-Tsagan-Obo, 60 km ENE Bayan- Burda,

FEMALE. Body length 4.5−6 mm . Shape. Head transverse ( 0.80−0.84 ), as wide as mesosoma. Pedicel as long as wide; F 1 elongate, 1.6 F 2 , shorter than F 2 and F 3 together; F 2 −F 5 short, transverse, F 2 shorter than F 3 ; F 6 −F 8 as long as wide, F 9 elongate. Labral plate rounded, twice wider than long, with transversal depression. Facial fovea straight, narrow, apically not enlarged; as wide as distance to eye, lower part wider than distance to eye. Genal area as wide as, or slightly narrower than eye ( 0.8−1.1 ), gradually narrowing toward mandible. Middle basitarsus 3−3.5 times as long as wide, parallel-sided, slightly narrowed at both ends, apically straight; TM 2 >TM 3 >TM 4 , TM 5 longer than TM 2 . Hind basitarsus 5−5.5 times as long as wide, parallel-sided, apically with sharp process; TM 2 >TM 3 >TM 4 , TM 4 as long as wide, TM 5 longer than TM 2 . Metasomal terga with depressed marginal zone, on T 1 ca 1 / 3 , on other terga ca 2 / 3 discal length; premarginal line rounded, more abrupt under dorsolateral convexities. Sculpture. Vertex shiny, finely shagreened, with deep, round pits a diameter or less apart ( 15 µm / 0.5−1 ). Paraocular area finely tessellate, on upper part with small, deep, round pits about a pit diameter apart ( 10 µm / 1–2 ), below pits larger and wider spaced ( 15−20 µm / 1−3 ). Frons tessellate, with small, deep pits ( 10 µm / 1−2 ) laterally sparser. Genal area glossy, posteriorly delicately shagreened, with pits 1−2 diameters apart ( 15–25 µm / 0.5−3 ), towards eye wider spaced, along eye impunctate. Supraclypeal and subantennal areas tessellate, with round pits ( 10−20 µm) about 3 diameters apart. Clypeus shiny, basally and laterally tessellate, with large pits ( 20−25 µm / 1−4 ) and punctures; on apico-lateral corners pits dense to confluent. Scutum shiny, on anterior quarter delicately shagreened, on disc smooth or tessellate, with irregularly spaced punctures and pits of different sizes (5, 10− 20 µm / 1−4 ); on periphery small pits dense to confluent. Scutellum on disc glossy, widely impunctate, on periphery shagreened. Metanotum with shallow, small, round pits merged. Mesepisternum shagreened, with, shallow pits 1−3 diameters apart ( 15−20 µm / 1−3 ). Propodeum shagreened; horizontal part of propodeal triangle rugose. Metasomal terga smooth, with punctures and tiny pits a few diameters apart ( 5−10 µm / 1−4 ), marginal zone tessellate, premarginal line rounded, under dorso-lateral convexities more abrupt. T 1 glossy, with punctuation sparser than on the following terga, basally punctures denser; T 2 and T 3 glossy, basally tessellate; T 4 tessellate. Metasomal sterna shiny, deeply tessellate, with dense, small pores ( 5−10 µm /> 2 ); S 3 −S 5 basally impunctate. Coloration. Wing brown; veins and tegulae pale or dark brown. Flagellum beneath yellowish-brown. Spurs yellow. Pygidial plate basally reddish and apically black. Vestiture. Pubescence white or yellowish. T 2 –T 4 with short, thin hairs, laterally and on premarginal lines longer. Prepygidial and pygidial fimbriae beige or brown. Metasomal sterna with short, thin hairs sparse, apically denser and longer; S 5 with dense, long hair fringe.

Remarks. Revision of the literature indicated that no one had the opportunity to study the type specimen after Nylander and that the type specimen was likely lost after the description was done (
Friese, 1897
;
Cockerell, 1922
). However, the type is in the Finnish Museum of Natural History (Helsinki) and is a senior synonym of
P. dubius
Osytshnjuk 1995
.
